data.title: L'homme glial est arrivé
data.summary:
Le cerveau humain est composé de milliards de neurones. Cet organe contient également un autre type de cellules, encore plus nombreuses, négligées jusque-là: les cellules gliales. 
Gros plan sur les astrocytes, un type de cellule gliale, et leur rôle avec Pierre Magistretti, neuroscientifique et auteur de "L'Homme glial", interrogé par Cécile Guérin.

data.title: Adeline Chetail, comédienne de doublage
data.summary:
Participants hors thésaurus : Chetail, Adeline
Contributeurs hors thésaurus : Cudry Gross, Marie-Claude
Adeline Chetail est touche à tout: cinéma, télévision, théâtre, elle travaille cependant énormément pour le doublage de voix. Elle y puise une grande satisfaction, car elle peut y interpréter une multitude de rôles différents. Elle joue au théâtre pour la première fois à l'âge de 6 ans en compagnie de son père et à 7 ans, elle double les petits lapins dans le dessin animé Bambi. Depuis 1994, on l'entend aussi bien au cinéma comme dans Forest Gump où elle fait la voix de Jenny, qu'à la télévision ou dans les publicités. Adeline Chetail est aujourd'hui l'invitée de Mélanie Croubalian.

data.title: Facebook, le grand réveil ?
data.summary: Débat sur l'usage des données personnelles que récoltent les entreprises ou réseaux sociaux. Les révélations sur le vol de données Facebook pour influencer les élections américaines de 2016 ou le vote sur le Brexit en 2016 montrent la potentialité énorme et dangereuse que recèle ses données.

chapters.title: Données personnelles, les risques
chapters.excerpt: L'utilisation de données personnelles par des entreprises est multiple. Des assureurs comme Helsana par exemple observent l'hygiène de vie de leurs clients pour fixer le montant des primes.

sequences.summary: Débat avec Sébastien Fanti, avocat et préposé à la protection des données en Valais, Nicolas Jutzet, président des Jeunes PLR neuchâtelois, Solange Ghernaouti, professeure à la HEC Lausanne, Romain Sickenberg, apprenti développeur, Cécile Rivière, responsable de projet chez Economiesuisse, Jurgi Camblong, CEO de Sophia Genetics.

scripts:
1 
 

 

ROAD TO THE 2018 FIFA WORLD CUP™ 

Programme 4 

10:00:23 This is the Road to the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ 

 

10:00:27 Today we run the rule over group E hopefuls Serbia 

 

10:00:32 And take a look at two of the contenders for the Adidas golden boot. 

 

10:00:37 We start the show 5,800 kilometres from Moscow to take a look at the team 

who were the first African nation to qualify for Russia 2018. 

 

10:00:47 Nigeria, with the biggest population in Africa, have only missed one FIFA 

World Cup™ since making their debut in 1994. 

 

10:00:57 The Super Eagles side who played at that tournament are widely considered 

as the country’s greatest group of players, with a team that included the likes 

of Finidi George, Daniel Amokachi, and the talismanic, Jay-Jay Okocha.  

 

10:01:10 24 years after their FIFA World Cup™ debut at USA 94, Okocha’s nephew, 

Alex Iwobi scored the goal in qualification that took Nigeria to their sixth 

global finals. 

 

10:01:29 Drawn in what many considered the toughest group in African qualifying, 

Nigeria proved dominant, securing their place in Russia with a game to spare 

and beating the likes of Zambia, Cameroon and Algeria along the way. 

 

 



2 
 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:01:42 When we saw the draw at first and we saw the group, we believed it would 

be very very difficult because Algeria at that moment was number 1 in 

Africa, Cameroon is becoming Champion of Africa and Zambia is becoming 

Champion of Africa under 20, so we were not terrified of this group but um 

we believed in our team, in our players.   

 

Wilfred Ndidi, Midfielder  

10:02:05 Everyone in the group was really tough. The Zambians, you feel, oh they're 

not the big names, like the other countries, but we took everything the 

same that was the philosophy from the coach. So, I think, that made us go 

through.   

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:02:22 We knew it was going to be tough. We have a very young team but 

everybody, they all play in Europe, they have the experience and they are 

all very good with the ball. We were so far ahead of everyone in the group 

and then we managed to finish the group as leaders, and we were very 

proud of that. 

 

10:02:41 On the pitch, the side is led by the seasoned John Obi Mikel, but their x-factor 

in Russia could be the youthful streak that runs throughout the side.  

 

10:02:50 With the likes of Abdullahi Shehu, William Troost-Ekong, and Wilfired Ndidi 

filling the defensive positions and Alex Iwobi, Kelechi Iheanacho and Moses 

Simon scoring crucial goals in qualifying, there is something of a fresh feel to 

the team 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:03:08 We choose young players, we wanted to build a new team, and I see now 

that we are the youngest one of the World Cup. Nigeria had already very 



3 
 

good teams, very big players, the level is very high to be better than them 

will not be easy for our young players but we are on the good way. 

 

10:03:32 Nigeria’s coach, Gernot Rohr, has plenty of experience on the continent 

having previously coached three African nations. He has radically improved 

the side, infusing the freshness of youth into a team who struggled prior to 

his appointment.  

 

10:03:45 Tactically, the team are based on a sturdy defence, with energetic ball-

winners at the base of midfield and the calming presence of John Obi Mikel in 

the number 10 position.  

 

10:03:58 Since Rohr took over in 2016, he has lost just once and knitted together a 

ruthless counterattacking side.  

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:04:02 The organisation was easy 4-2-3-1 or 4-3-3, everybody could play in this 

system and we only tried in the friendlies other systems, so tactically it was 

ok, we had a little problem at first to build a stable defence, but the 

defence is becoming solid 

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:04:27 This team is one team that I've played with that like to play football. You 

know, you have Victor Moses, you have Kelechi Ihenacho, you have Alex 

Iwobi, you have Ndidi, you have Onazi, you have Etebo... these players all 

like to have the ball, and it's important for us. We like to play, and pass and 

move, the discipline, there's a lot of calmness in the team and everybody 

knows his job. Everybody knows what to do. Everybody knows that you 

can't let the team down. 

 

10:04:56 A key-man in those counter attacks and the teams star-player is Victor 

Moses. Crowned 2018 Nigerian Football Federation player of the year, the 



4 
 

Chelsea star appeared in four of the Super Eagles 6 qualifying games and 

scored three goals   

 

10:05:11 Although he plays right-wingback for his club side, it’s in the forward position 

he causes damage for his national team. 

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:05:17 Antonio Conte wants him to play as a right wing back, but Victor has always 

played as a right winger. Victor is young, he’s fast, he’s strong, and he’s 

powerful. He has everything. 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:05:35 Victor Moses, a fantastic player, he made the difference against Cameroon 

– when we beat the African champion 4-0 he was so fantastic and yes in the 

beginning, when I saw him the first time I immediately saw the talent, the 

qualities he had and we tried to bring it a quality system that he has also to 

play defensively and make the work when we don’t have the ball and he 

did it very well 

 

10:06:00 Drawn in group D, Nigeria kick-off their FIFA World Cup™ campaign on June 

16th against Croatia who reached the finals by beating Greece over two legs 

in the UEFA play offs.   

 

10:06:12 In what could be the most fiercely contested group in Russia, the Super 

Eagles will also play Iceland and Argentina.  

 

10:06:20 This will be the fifth time Nigeria will face La Albiceleste in their six 

tournament appearances with the South Americans having come out on top 

in each of their previous encounters. 

 

 

 



5 
 

Wilfred Ndidi, Midfielder  

10:06:29 Argentina team is very good. For me I would say Messi is unstoppable, I 

would say. Because he's one of the best players, we just have to try and win 

and give it all in the first two games and then face Argentina.  

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:06:45 I think we're in a group where we can do something, it depends on our 

preparation, it depends on how much we want it, how much we want to, 

not just "now we've qualified let's go and play in the World Cup, that's it 

fine, I played two or three games, that's it I'm done!". We want to make 

names, we want to make history, we want to do well. And we want to 

make sure we go there and believe we can beat Argentina, we can beat 

Croatia, we can beat Iceland.  

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:07:17 Of course, target is to play well, to give the best, to show to Nigeria that the 

players like to play for their country, they like to fight, and they like to win. 

We have a difficult group, will not be easy to come out, but we had already 

difficult group in the qualifiers. And we came out …I think will be a fantastic 

World Cup, it’s a joy for everybody to be here, but we would like also to 

have good results. 

 

10:07:54 We’re taking a look at the stadium where Nigeria will play their final group 

game now as we travel to the most northerly of the venues. 

 

10:08:05 St Petersburg is Russia’s second largest city after Moscow, the country’s 

cultural capital and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  

 



6 
 

10:08:11 The new 67,000 capacity St Petersburg stadium is located on the Neva River, 

although its northerly location provided some unique challenges for the 

designers.  

 

10:08:21 Built on the site of the Kirov Stadium on Krestovsky Island, the seven-storey 

structure is 79 metres high, with a retractable roof and sliding pitch. 

 

10:08:30 The venue is able to host events the whole year around as the temperature 

inside is regulated to 15 degrees Celsius, even in the depths of winter. 

 

10:08:39 The stadium played host to the opening match and the final of last year’s 

FIFA Confederations Cup, where Germany beat Chile 1-0. 

 

10:08:46 The St Petersburg stadium will also play an integral part in the FIFA World 

Cup™, hosting the likes of Russia, Brazil and Nigeria’s game with Argentina in 

a 7 match schedule that also includes a semi-final and the third place play off. 

 

10:08:59 But the action begins on June 15th as Morocco take on Iran in the opening 

game of Group B.  

 

10:09:07 In Hyundai Anatomy of a Goal, we go back to USA ‘94 to replay a stunning 

strike from a Super Eagle on his FIFA World Cup™ debut. 

 

10:09:18 In 1994 the FIFA World Cup™ landed in North America bigger than ever, 

Record crowds packed into stadiums to watch the likes of Romario, Jurgen 

Klinsmann and Gabriel Batistuta light up the USA. 



7 
 

10:09:33 Amongst the glitz and glamour, Nigeria arrived at the tournament to make 

their finals debut, boasting a FIFA World Ranking of 5th - the highest ever for 

an African nation. 

 

10:09:43 Clemens Westerhof’s side got off to the perfect start, beating Bulgaria 3-0 in 

their opening match.   

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:09:50 I had school the next morning and I think it was quite late in Nigeria, but 

everybody stayed up to watch the game. I remember my parents watching 

and trying to wake me up. I saw when Rashidi Yekini scored and he was 

doing that in the net in the goal.  

 

10:10:06 I think that was pretty much what I hold and what I remember of the World 

Cup.   

 

10:10:16 But defeat to Argentina left their hopes in the balance going into the final 

group game against Greece. 

 

10:10:24 Already ahead thanks to Finidi George’s opener, in the 95th minute, striker 

Daniel Amokachi was given space to turn in midfield, and made Greece pay 

with a demonstration of pace, power and perfect finishing. 

 

10:10:40 Replaying the goal we can see that, as Nigeria win back possession, Amokachi 

has already dropped deep into space and calls for the ball.  

 



8 
 

10:10:49 With the nearest Greek player more than 6 metres away, the Super Eagles 

number 14, has time to turn and head towards goal. 

 

10:11:00 With Greece’s centre half moving towards the right, it opens up the perfect 

angle for the Nigerian to advance and shoot. 

 

10:11:10 The ball accelerates to over 60 miles an hour past the helpless Christos 

Karkamanis in goal. 

 

10:11:17 In the next round, Amokachi and Nigeria came within seconds of knocking 

out eventual finalists Italy, before a Roberto Baggio brace rescued the Azzuri.  

 

10:11:28 While it may ultimately be a case of what might have been for the Super 

Eagles golden generation, in Amokachi’s goal they have a FIFA World Cup™ 

moment that will be remembered for years to come. 

 

10:11:41 We’re checking out two modern day strikers now and potential contenders 

for the Adidas golden boot – Robert Lewandowski of Poland and England’s 

Harry Kane. 

 

10:11:51 Using the CIES football observatory’s player rating system we’re going to 

compare their statistics in terms of shooting, distribution and taking on 

opponents. 

 

10:12:00 When it comes to prowess in front of goal both score an impressive 99 out of 

100 for shooting - a testament to their accuracy and composure.  

 



9 
 

10:12:08 While Kane found the back of the net 5 times for England in the FIFA World 

Cup™ qualifiers, 29-year-old Lewandowski scored a European high 16 goals 

which was over half of the 28 Poland scored in their campaign. 

 

Wojciech Szczęsny, Goalkeeper, Poland 

10:12:24 He has an enormous impact on the Polish team. Not only with his goals, as 

he scores lots of them, and most of our goals in these qualifiers were scored 

by Robert, but he was involved in creating them too.  

 

10:12:37 Equal when it comes to shooting, in terms of distribution the Polish striker 

edges his English counterpart with a 45 out of 100 compared to 35.  

 

10:12:46 Lewandowksi played all 10 of Poland’s qualifying matches, and despite most 

of his time being taken up by 37 attempts on goal, he still managed to set up 

Kamil Grosicki for the second strike in their 4-2 home victory against 

Montenegro.   

 

10:13:01 While the Polish star nudges it in terms of distribution, Kane has the better 

rating for taking on opponents  

 

10:13:07 It’s this trait that has helped him score a record-breaking 37 goals for Spurs in 

the English premier league and he has now scored 12 times in 23 

appearances for England. 

 

Gareth Southgate, Coach, England 

10:13:17 His goal scoring record at the moment speaks for itself, in terms of out an 

out number 9s, he is, no question, one of the best in the world. 

 



10 
 

10:13:25 He's proven that now, not just one season in the premier league, but 

season after season, and the last calendar year that he had was better than 

anyone else in Europe 

 

10:13:36 Despite the goal difference, that means the Englishman scores marginally 

higher overall on the CIES football index with 89 out of 100 compared to 

Lewandowski’s 88. 

 

10:13:47 With both Poland and England having had Adidas Golden Boot winners in the 

past, that award should not be out of reach for their current number nines. 

These two old-fashioned centre forwards can score almost any type of goal 

making them ones to watch in Russia. 

 

10:14:03 From 2 of Europe’s finest strikers, we stay with the European challenge, but 

travel 1,700 kilometres south-west of Moscow to take a closer look at the 

team who finished top of UEFA qualifying group D 

 

10:14:15 Ranked 37  Serbia return to the FIFA World Cup™ finals after an absence of 8 

years, and for only the second time after becoming an independent nation in 

2006.  

 

10:14:26 The team previously competed in the tournament as part of the Kingdom of 

Yugoslavia, SFR Yugoslavia, and Serbia and Montenegro.  

 

10:14:34 Their most notable appearance was in 1962 when they made it to the semi-

finals beating West Germany along the way.  

 



11 
 

10:14:42 Serbia qualified for the Russia 2018 in emphatic style. With only one defeat in 

10 matches, they scored the most goals in their group, outplaying the likes of 

Austria, the Republic of Ireland and Euro 2016 semi-finalists Wales. 

 

10:14:58 That string of results included an away victory against the Republic of Ireland 

- one of the stand out matches of their campaign.  

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:15:15 In the second half, we started the match and after about ten minutes the 

ball was on one side and I saw that it would probably come over to my side 

and I ran into the space. Kostić saw me. 

 

10:15:26 The ball was coming towards me and all I could do was stretch my leg and 

score. I knew that if I could get the shot in, the goalkeeper wouldn’t stand a 

chance. 

 

10:15:37 That goal turned out to be the winner that was a really important match for 

us and that win opened the door for us to the World Cup. 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:15:50 It was a difficult match. We knew what was expected of us and we knew 

that a goal either way would be decisive in the match.  

 

10:15:59 So thank God, we scored that goal and we won that game and I think that 

was the key match that took us to the World Cup. 

 



12 
 

10:16:09 Despite that result, their place at Russia 2018 wasn’t sealed until a one nil 

home victory against Georgia on the final day of qualifying.  

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:16:24 Well, I think that for me as a player that was the best night in my career. I 

think that all children in Serbia dream that one day they will play for the 

national team, to play important matches, 

 

10:16:35 To earn a place at the World Cup and to represent their nation there. For 

me that is the biggest, most exciting, and happiest story in my career as a 

footballer.   

 

10:16:49 Having qualified, Slavoljub Muslin was removed as coach, and replaced by the 

man who was his assistant, Mladen Krstajic.  

 

10:16:58 The former national team player could well turn out to be the side’s x-factor 

in Russia.  Having played for Serbia himself at the tournament, his experience 

on the FIFA World Cup™ stage could prove vital. 

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:17:10 One thing is for sure, it is an honour to be part of the national team, and 

especially being the selector for your own country is something that cannot 

be put into words, it can only be experienced. 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:17:24 He is big in Serbian football. Previously he was a great player who played 

for big teams and of course it means a lot to have somebody like that, who 

can give advice in those key matches. He went through that already and he 



13 
 

would advise us in the best possible way how to prepare for those difficult 

and important matches when everybody expects a lot from us. 

 

10:17:44 Krstajić is bringing his own style to the team’s formation, shoring up the 

defensive, and using his own playing experience to instigate change.  

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:17:55 As a coach and the man in charge of the Serbian team, I like the team to be 

compact in the defensive zone, but when they pass the halfway line, I want 

them to have their freedom in the game, and to do what they know best.  

 

10:18:08 The way I look at football in a way that we don’t have to be its slaves, we 

should enjoy football, because football is played with the heart and for 

fans, of course. 

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:18:19 During qualifying and for the first time since I’ve been in the team we 

played with three defenders. Let’s say we played a 3-4-3 formation with 

two wingers that come inside, a main striker and four in midfield. 

 

10:18:33 Myself and the right wing-back were really involved. 

 

10:18:36 I can say that was a specific style of playing. Not many national teams play 

that kind of game. When Krstajić came in as manager, the last two matches 

we played were friendlies and we played 4 at the back. So, I think that in 

the future we will continue playing that way and with 3 midfielders. These 

are all our coach’s plans. We play the way we are asked to. 

 



14 
 

10:19:01 Serbia’s star player is their captain Branislav Ivanovic. An experienced and 

respected member of the squad, he has led the team since 2012 and 

currently plays his club football in Russia for Zenit Saint Petersburg. 

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:19:16 He is really important, for sure. One number in a hundred games as part of 

the national team means a lot, and that says a lot about Bane Ivanović, as a 

person and as a player as well. His games are seen and recognized, and 

recorded worldwide I can talk about him only in superlatives.  

 

10:19:33 He was the coach’s right-hand man before, and has remained as such, even 

today, when I have the coach’s position 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:19:45 Branislav - I don’t know how he looks on the field, maybe scary, but he is, 

first of all, a very good person. I think that even he, himself, is not aware 

how successful he is in his career, how much he has achieved and when he 

finishes his career he is going to realize how great he is.  

 

10:20:06 Serbia kick off their campaign on the 17th of June against Costa Rica who 

were surprise quarter finalists at the 2014 FIFA World Cup™. 

 

10:20:15 But in a group that also includes Brazil, they’ll have to be at the top of their 

game to reach the knockout stages in Russia.  

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:20:25 We have to try to take our chances in the matches against Costa Rica and 

Switzerland. I think we got a good deal. We play the third match against 



15 
 

Brazil so let’s hope that we won’t get to that match to decide whether we 

get through or not.  If it comes to that, we will fight to go further. 

 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:20:46 I think we have a team, especially now, a team with players who can play 

against Brazil and every single national team in the world.  

 

10:20:55 We have a great team and as I said, we will see… I hope that we are going 

to pass forward from the group, that’s the first goal. We will see, with God’s 

help. 

 

10:21:15 Serbia’s group opponents Brazil are the focus of our FIFA World Cup™ firsts 

now as we look back at the 1950 and 2014 tournaments. 

 

10:21:24 Unlike previous editions, the 1950 FIFA World Cup™ would be the first and 

only one not to have a final. 

 

10:21:32 Instead, in the deciding match of the tournament, hosts Brazil needed just a 

draw against Uruguay to see them crowned champions.  

 

10:21:41 In front of a crowd of almost 200 000 at the Maracana, Friaca gave the home 

side the lead. 

 

10:21:51 Uruguay weren’t to be overawed though, as Juan Schiaffino equalised just 

past the hour mark. 

 



16 
 

10:21:59 And 11 minutes from time, one of the biggest upsets at a finals was 

completed as Alcides Ghiggia scored to send a newly named Jules Rimet 

trophy back to Uruguay for the 2nd time. 

 

10:22:13 When Brazil next hosted the FIFA World Cup™ in 2014, the tournament 

marked the debut for goal line technology, along with vanishing spray used 

by referees.   

 

10:22:25 Greece and Algeria were making their debuts in the FIFA World Cup™ finals, 

with the North African side making it through to the round of 16 where they 

lost to Germany after extra time.   

 

10:22:38 Hosts Brazil had topped their group, and following victories over Chile and 

Colombia, made it through to their fourth consecutive FIFA World Cup™ 

semi-final.  

 

10:22:47 Their opponents at the Maracana were Germany, and over the course of 90 

minutes, a whole host of records were broken.  

 

10:22:55 Miroslav Klose overtook Ronaldo as the tournament’s all-time leading scorer 

as he netted his 16th FIFA World Cup™ goal in the 23rd minute.    

 

10:23:09 Germany’s 7-1 victory saw them replace Brazil as the highest scoring team in 

the tournament’s history and become the first team to reach 8 FIFA World 

Cup finals™;  

 



17 
 

10:23:22 But there were still two more firsts to come as Germany met Argentina in the 

final. 

10:23:29 The only goal of the game came in extra time, as Mario Gotze became the 

first substitute to score the winning goal in a FIFA World Cup final™. 

 

10:23:40 And it was a result that gave Germany the honour of becoming the first 

European side to win the trophy in the Americas.  

 

10:23:52 Finally, we’re with Argentina goalkeeper Sergio Romero, as the Brazil 2014 

finalist gives us his favourite FIFA World Cup™ memory. 

 

10:24:01 For Argentina, the 2014 tournament proved their most successful in almost 

25 years. After winning their group and despatching Switzerland and Belgium 

in the knockout stages they came up against the Netherlands in the semi-

finals. 

 

Sergio Romero, Goalkeeper (ARG) 

10:24:15 It was a truly tactical game. If we had the ball, then Holland defended. And 

if Holland had the ball, then we defended. We were well positioned, it was 

completely tactical, with very few chances to score for both sides.  

 

10:24:27 After 120 minutes had failed to separate them, the game went to penalties. 

With the spotlight now on the two keepers, Romero received some words of 

advice from team mate Javier Mascherano. 

 

 



18 
 

Sergio Romero, Goalkeeper (ARG) 

10:24:39 I’d already talked to the coach Alejandro, and the other goalkeepers 

Mariano and Agustin and when I was heading over to talk to the referees, 

Mascherano grabbed hold of me, and well he told me to think about all of 

the people who had helped me get to that moment.  That everything was 

going was going to be okay, and he ended by saying that I was going to be a 

hero. So I was already confident, but these words made me even more 

confident. It’s at times like that you really see the people who have your 

back, and you never forget that moment. 

 

10:25:15 It took only a matter of seconds for Mascherano’s prediction to come true, as 

Romero dived first to his left and then to his right saving two penalties in the 

shootout. 

 

10:24:24 His heroics sent Argentina through to the final.  Germany were to deny them 

a third FIFA World Cup™, but for the goalkeeper the moment when he 

became a hero in the semi-finals is one he will never forget. 

 

10:24:39 That’s it for now, but join us next time as we continue on the Road to the 

2018 FIFA World Cup™ in Russia.

chapters.title: En route pour le Mondial N°4

data.summary: Emission décentralisée à Avenches dans le canton de Fribourg pour l'émission hors studio de Couleurs Locales avec Fabienne Pambianco Carella qui fait découvrir des lieux de Suisse romande en lien avec l'actualité du jour.
alternativeTitle: Portrait de Stéphane Augsburger, boulanger le jour et écrivain la nuit
GE: vélos et rails de trams ne font pas bon ménage
Entretien avec Charles Trolliet, secrétaire du Conseil et Observatoire suisse de la filière du cheval
Entretien avec Jean-Pierre Kratzer, fondateur de l’Institut équestre national d’Avenches
subTitles:
17:36:02:07  17:36:39:19
...

17:36:39:21  17:36:41:11
             -Bonsoir.

17:36:41:13  17:36:43:11
        On est à Avenches.

17:36:43:13  17:36:45:19
 La région souhaite tirer un trait

17:36:45:21  17:36:48:11
sur les événements de l'an dernier.

17:36:48:13  17:36:52:01
     Des incendies criminels 
     avaient frappé la Broye.

17:36:52:03  17:36:59:11
L'Institut Equestre National a perdu
   plusieurs bâtiments et bêtes.

17:36:59:13  17:37:04:14
     Sa réouverture complète 
     est prévue pour cet été.

17:37:04:16  17:37:08:04
 On fera le point sur les travaux.

17:37:08:06  17:37:14:01
   Et on verra les spécificités
    géographiques de la Broye,

17:37:14:03  17:37:17:14
           qui se joue
    des frontières cantonales.

17:37:17:16  17:37:24:17
  Et on rencontrera un boulanger,
    qui écrit aussi des polars.

17:37:24:19  17:37:28:16
     Mais d'abord, l'essentiel
  de l'actualité romande du jour.

17:37:32:07  17:37:36:08
  -Sur la crête du Mollendruz, 
 12 éoliennes seront implantées.

17:37:36:10  17:37:40:11
    Hier soir, les villageois
de La Praz ont accepté le projet.

17:37:40:13  17:37:43:11
   Ils votaient sur cet objet
       pour la 2ème fois.

17:37:43:12  17:37:46:23
           En janvier,
ils avaient refusé le parc éolien.

17:37:47:01  17:37:51:11
         La Municipalité
a alors organisé un 2ème scrutin.

17:37:52:14  17:37:55:00
-Il y a eu un manque d'information.

17:37:55:02  17:37:57:12
  Pour beaucoup, c'était acquis,

17:37:57:14  17:38:00:15
     et ils ne sont pas venus.

17:38:00:17  17:38:02:18
   En rencontrant ces habitants,

17:38:02:20  17:38:06:22
 on a compris qu'ils regrettaient
      de ne pas être venus.

17:38:07:12  17:38:11:16
   -Il faudra encore patienter
avant l'installation des turbines.

17:38:11:18  17:38:15:01
   Les opposants ont annoncés
     vouloir faire recours.

17:38:16:16  17:38:21:04
-Le WWF, Pro Natura, l'Association
    transport et environnement

17:38:21:06  17:38:24:12
et les Verts valaisans disent NON

17:38:24:14  17:38:28:07
    à la candidature de Sion
     aux jeux d'hiver 2016.

17:38:28:09  17:38:33:14
    Lancement d'une campagne
  qui tournera autour du budget

17:38:33:16  17:38:39:10
     et de ce que les citoyens
devront payer en cas d'acceptation.

17:38:39:11  17:38:44:02
   Les opposants ne croient pas
en une candidature à taille humaine

17:38:44:04  17:38:48:08
         et encore moins
      à un budget maîtrisé.

17:38:50:11  17:38:55:14
 -A Fribourg, le tribunal pénal
  économique doit s'expliquer

17:38:55:16  17:39:00:15
sur 6 acquittements dans l'affaire
    de la caisse de prévoyance

17:39:00:17  17:39:09:10
     des communes de la Sarine
pour les services médicaux-sociaux.

17:39:09:11  17:39:14:05
    Le ministère public estime
les motifs présentés contestables.

17:39:14:07  17:39:16:22
         Il a fait appel
      au Tribunal cantonal.

17:39:18:14  17:39:33:06
...

17:39:33:08  17:39:38:06
-On est sur le chantier de l'Institut
Equestre National d'Avenches (IENA).

17:39:38:08  17:39:43:04
       J-P.Kratzer, bonjour.
             -Bonjour.

17:39:43:06  17:39:46:18
  -Où en est la reconstruction ?

17:39:46:20  17:39:49:09
         -Ca avance bien.

17:39:49:11  17:39:51:19
 On est huit mois après l'incendie

17:39:51:21  17:39:54:00
    et on espère avoir terminé

17:39:54:02  17:39:56:01
        pour le 15 juillet.

17:39:56:03  17:39:58:15
    Ici, on reconstruit 32 box.

17:39:58:17  17:40:02:08
        -Ce sera pile 1 an
      après les événements ?

17:40:02:10  17:40:07:04
  Vous y pensez encore souvent ?

17:40:07:06  17:40:10:21
   -Tous ceux qui les ont vécus
        de près ou de loin

17:40:10:23  17:40:15:03
en garderont un souvenir difficile.

17:40:15:05  17:40:18:16
 Le feu détruit, ça marque à vie.

17:40:18:18  17:40:22:14
  Mais on essaie de reconstruire,
        d'aller de l'avant,

17:40:22:16  17:40:27:11
         ça aide beaucoup
tous ceux qui ont vécu ce sinistre.

17:40:27:12  17:40:30:11
-Vous allez en profiter pour revoir

17:40:30:12  17:40:35:03
       le concept de l'IENA
        et des bâtiments ?

17:40:35:05  17:40:44:22
    -Oui, quand on a un malheur,
je le prends plutôt comme une chance.

17:40:45:00  17:40:50:16
      Ici, on va reconstruire
   l'école de poney plus grande.

17:40:50:18  17:40:56:11
 Et on va développer un programme
   plus vaste pour la jeunesse

17:40:56:12  17:41:03:23
    avec les poneys trotteurs 
    et aussi avec les chevaux.

17:41:04:01  17:41:05:20
     -C'est un signal positif

17:41:05:22  17:41:10:07
      que vous voulez donner
   et retenir de cette tragédie.

17:41:10:09  17:41:13:13
              Merci. 
              -Merci.

17:41:14:16  17:41:18:08
        -Outre l'été passé,
    où elle a fait l'actualité,

17:41:18:10  17:41:26:09
 la Broye est une région discrète,
  à cheval sur Vaud et Fribourg.

17:41:26:11  17:41:31:07
C'est notre rubrique "Vu du ciel".

17:41:37:01  17:41:41:07
     -La Broye, une rivière
  qui sépare Fribourg et Vaud.

17:41:41:09  17:41:47:12
          Mais rapidement,
la frontière morcelle le territoire.

17:41:47:14  17:41:54:09
Ici, Vaud et Fribourg s'enlacent,
      créant des enclaves.

17:41:55:11  17:41:57:20
-C'est des héritages du Moyen Age,

17:41:57:22  17:41:59:15
      où différents seigneurs

17:41:59:17  17:42:06:03
    ont occupé des territoires
 qui étaient un bailliage bernois.

17:42:07:03  17:42:10:11
   -Un héritage devenu un défi
       pour les autorités.

17:42:10:13  17:42:16:12
     Les Broyards partagent
 leurs services à la population.

17:42:17:19  17:42:21:00
-C'est une collaboration perpétuelle
            pour savoir

17:42:21:02  17:42:23:20
        quel est le service
         le plus efficace.

17:42:23:22  17:42:30:03
      On doit parfois déroger
      aux systèmes cantonaux.

17:42:30:05  17:42:36:16
   Ca demande des négociations.

17:42:38:00  17:42:43:01
-Tout porte le label intercantonal:
     le gymnase, l'hôpital...

17:42:43:03  17:42:48:10
 Les frontières divisent, mais la 
pierre de la Molière unit la Broye.

17:42:49:03  17:42:54:16
     -Elle est autant utilisée
     à Estavayer qu'à Payerne.

17:42:54:18  17:43:03:19
     Il y a aussi de la pierre
 de la Molière à la gare de Zurich

17:43:03:21  17:43:11:04
      et dans la construction
     du Grand Conseil vaudois.

17:43:12:07  17:43:17:18
-Presque de quoi y bâtir une région
autonome avec ses 70'000 habitants.

17:43:18:23  17:43:21:10
-Certains citoyens m'ont dit de faire

17:43:21:11  17:43:23:10
      une région de la Broye.

17:43:23:11  17:43:30:00
     Mais les gens sont fiers
  d'être fribourgeois ou vaudois.

17:43:30:21  17:43:35:16
 -Région originale, qui sait être
à la hauteur des grands événements

17:43:35:18  17:43:39:18
      tels que la dernière 
     fête fédérale de lutte.

17:43:41:04  17:44:07:20
...

17:44:07:22  17:44:14:08
  -Le Haras national d'Avenches
est le centre de compétence suisse

17:44:14:10  17:44:20:21
     pour l'élevage du cheval.

17:44:20:23  17:44:25:21
Il est chargé de la formation, de la
 recherche et de la mise en valeur

17:44:25:23  17:44:33:04
  de la race Franches-Montagnes,
   unique race indigène suisse.

17:44:33:06  17:44:44:03
...

17:44:46:19  17:44:50:06
    L'avenir du Haras national
     suscite des inquiétudes.

17:44:50:08  17:44:54:17
  Début mars, le Conseil fédéral
a annoncé vouloir couper le budget

17:44:54:19  17:44:57:19
         de l'Agroscope,
  dont dépend le Haras, de 20 %.

17:44:57:21  17:45:01:11
            C.Trolliet,
    quelles sont vos craintes ?

17:45:01:20  17:45:04:19
-Nous craignons que ces réductions

17:45:04:21  17:45:07:22
aient des conséquences sur le Haras

17:45:08:00  17:45:13:07
   et ses différentes missions.

17:45:13:09  17:45:16:10
   Nous ne pouvons pas accepter

17:45:16:11  17:45:21:15
    que ce que le Haras fournit
     pour la filière diminue.

17:45:22:05  17:45:25:11
-Ces craintes sont-elles fondées ?

17:45:25:13  17:45:28:13
Il y a déjà eu des restructurations.

17:45:29:02  17:45:31:18
-Il y a eu des menaces de fermeture,

17:45:31:20  17:45:34:12
          qui ont conduit
      à certaines réductions.

17:45:34:14  17:45:39:02
    On a peur qu'on nous enlève
      des choses par morceaux

17:45:39:04  17:45:42:23
          et que le Haras
   devienne une coquille vide...

17:45:43:10  17:45:48:19
       -L'importance du cheval
dans l'agriculture est sous-estimée ?

17:45:49:07  17:45:54:10
           -Sa présence
   joue un rôle non négligeable

17:45:54:11  17:45:58:15
    dans les revenus agricoles,
 tels que la production de chevaux

17:45:58:17  17:46:02:13
   et la production de fourrage.

17:46:02:15  17:46:05:04
Ces éléments ne sont pas négligeables

17:46:05:06  17:46:11:10
         dans les comptes
     de l'agriculture suisse.

17:46:11:11  17:46:14:11
         -Merci beaucoup.
             -Merci.

17:46:22:17  17:46:27:13
 -Les amoureux de la petite reine 
attendaient le retour du printemps.

17:46:27:15  17:46:35:02
   Attention aux chutes: les rails
de tram sont des obstacles périlleux.

17:46:35:04  17:46:39:15
         Direction Genève.

17:46:43:20  17:46:48:08
-C'est LE cauchemar des cyclistes:
        les rails de tram.

17:46:48:10  17:46:53:13
  A Genève, avec plus de 33 km
  de réseau, ils sont partout.

17:46:53:15  17:46:59:11
       On tente de les éviter
mais parfois, il faut les croiser...

17:46:59:13  17:47:02:07
     ...au risque de chuter.

17:47:02:09  17:47:04:15
Certains en ont fait leur combat.

17:47:04:17  17:47:08:09
Rendez-vous sur un des carrefours
       les plus dangereux.

17:47:08:20  17:47:10:23
  -Ici, il a des bus, des trams,

17:47:11:01  17:47:12:18
     des vélos, des voitures.

17:47:12:20  17:47:16:22
      Tous doivent se côtoyer,
se dépasser et changer de direction.

17:47:17:00  17:47:21:14
Les vélos doivent croiser les rails
      non pas à angle droit,

17:47:21:16  17:47:23:18
       mais en les longeant.

17:47:23:20  17:47:25:15
        C'est le problème.

17:47:27:12  17:47:30:19
-Tout serait une histoire d'angle,

17:47:30:21  17:47:35:12
        comme l'a montré
      une étude américaine.

17:47:35:14  17:47:43:04
        Après avoir filmé
   un carrefour problématique,

17:47:43:06  17:47:47:11
  il ressort que l'angle idéal
 est de 90 degrés pour croiser.

17:47:47:12  17:47:50:00
60 degrés est un angle confortable,

17:47:50:02  17:47:52:19
         et moins de 30,
     c'est la chute assurée.

17:47:52:21  17:47:55:12
         Le département
     des transports genevois

17:47:55:14  17:47:58:02
reçoit régulièrement des plaintes.

17:47:58:12  17:48:00:23
 -Quand on pose de nouvelle rames,

17:48:01:01  17:48:04:02
on essaie de séparer les itinéraires

17:48:04:04  17:48:11:08
      des vélos et des trams.

17:48:11:10  17:48:17:15
      Mais parfois, le vélo
est obligé de traverser les rails.

17:48:18:00  17:48:22:06
-A Genève, quatre zones dangereuses
       ont été identifiées.

17:48:22:08  17:48:28:14
On veut y installer un dispositif
  inédit en Suisse: vélostrail.

17:48:29:14  17:48:35:02
      -C'est un caoutchouc,
qui rehausse la profondeur du rail

17:48:35:04  17:48:44:22
pour que si la roue se glisse dans
le rail, le cycliste ne chute pas.

17:48:46:01  17:48:54:07
-Un rapport sur les zones en cours
de test sera rendu prochainement.

17:48:56:01  17:49:12:23
...

17:49:13:01  17:49:17:08
      -Partons à la découverte
d'un boulanger pas comme les autres.

17:49:17:10  17:49:22:02
       Il travaille la nuit
        et écrit le jour,

17:49:22:04  17:49:26:16
           des enquêtes
 qui se déroulent dans sa région.

17:49:30:15  17:49:36:10
    -"Vers 10h00, le téléphone
  sonna dans le poste de police."

17:49:36:11  17:49:41:06
  "C'est Pénélope qui décrocha."

17:49:41:08  17:49:46:11
   "C'était Hans, qui demandait 
  à parler à l'un des policiers."

17:49:46:13  17:49:56:02
     "Elle fit signe à Bruno 
    et lui tendit le combiné."

17:49:56:04  17:49:59:13
          "-C'est Bruno,
     que puis-je pour vous ?"

17:50:00:21  17:50:06:02
  -S.Augsburger est un écrivain
      pas comme les autres.

17:50:06:14  17:50:11:11
-Je suis peut-être le seul boulanger

17:50:11:12  17:50:15:12
  de Suisse qui écrit des romans.

17:50:15:22  17:50:20:03
 -Féru de chroniques judiciaires
   et boulanger depuis 30 ans,

17:50:20:05  17:50:26:12
 il doit s'organiser pour faire
 cohabiter la plume et la pâte.

17:50:27:04  17:50:31:08
-Contrairement aux autres écrivains,

17:50:31:10  17:50:34:01
       je travaille la nuit
        et écris le jour.

17:50:34:12  17:50:38:21
-Il vient de publier son 4ème roman.

17:50:38:23  17:50:44:02
        Il s'est lancé dans
l'aventure littéraire il y a 7 ans.

17:50:44:04  17:50:51:18
        La toile de fond:
le Jura bernois et ses habitants.

17:50:52:10  17:50:56:07
  -J'ai commencé avec les livres
     de la Comtesse de Ségur,

17:50:56:09  17:50:58:01
           puis j'ai lu

17:50:58:03  17:51:00:19
     des classiques policiers.

17:51:00:21  17:51:04:23
J'ai été baigné dans cette ambiance

17:51:05:01  17:51:13:14
     et ai donc voulu essayer 
    d'écrire un roman policier.

17:51:14:07  17:51:17:12
-La 4ème enquête de S.Augsburger

17:51:17:14  17:51:20:14
  se déroule sous les éoliennes
         de son village.

17:51:20:16  17:51:24:21
  Dans la réalité aussi, elles
ont fait couler beaucoup d'encre.

17:51:25:06  17:51:29:14
      -Le fait que le village
  se soit questionné sur le sujet

17:51:29:16  17:51:31:17
          m'a intéressé.

17:51:32:06  17:51:36:14
      -Contrairement au roman,
elles n'ont pas fait couler le sang.

17:51:37:02  17:51:41:09
    -J'ai exagéré la situation.

17:51:41:22  17:51:45:11
-Il écrit la fin de son 5ème roman.

17:51:45:12  17:51:51:06
      Il se déroulera aussi
      dans le Jura bernois.

17:51:51:18  17:51:55:10
    -C'est la région où je vis.

17:51:55:11  17:52:02:21
   J'aime décrire ses paysages.

17:52:03:12  17:52:14:07
  -Il se murmure que la 1ère page
de son 6ème roman serait déjà prête.

17:52:15:17  17:52:24:00
...

17:52:24:02  17:52:29:04
    -Demain, "Couleurs locales"
          fêtera Pâques.

17:52:29:06  17:52:32:17
       Nous serons au Musée
 d'histoire naturelle de Fribourg

17:52:32:19  17:52:36:06
        pour son exposition
      consacrée aux poussins.

17:52:36:08  17:52:40:13

data.title: Kadebostany
data.summary: En septembre 2017, Kadebostany sortait un EP intitulé "Monumetal : Chapter 1". 6 mois plus tard et à notre grande surprise, il n'y a pas eu d'EP chapitre 2 mais directement un album. Guillaume de Kadebostan est venu en visite officielle dans les studios d'Option Musique pour répondre aux questions de Cassien Brey sur ce nouveau disque de 13 titres. Il s'appelle "Monumental" et est à découvrir dans "L'Album suisse".

data.title: Développement durable, Agenda 2030 : Inégalités réduites
data.summary:
Les pays membres des Nations Unies ont défini 17 objectifs de développement durable à atteindre d'ici l'année 2030. L'objectif n° 10 concerne la réduction des inégalités. L'un des buts à atteindre est la mise en oeuvre d'un traitement spécial pour les pays en développement. 
Ridha Bouabid, Organisation Mondiale de la Propriété Intellectuelle : « Les objectifs de développement durable nécessitent un des technologies innovantes et il s'agit de faire bénéficier toutes les populations de cette innovation. chapters.scripts:
1 
 

 

ROAD TO THE 2018 FIFA WORLD CUP™ 

Programme 4 

10:00:23 This is the Road to the 2018 FIFA World Cup™ 

 

10:00:27 Today we run the rule over group E hopefuls Serbia 

 

10:00:32 And take a look at two of the contenders for the Adidas golden boot. 

 

10:00:37 We start the show 5,800 kilometres from Moscow to take a look at the team 

who were the first African nation to qualify for Russia 2018. 

 

10:00:47 Nigeria, with the biggest population in Africa, have only missed one FIFA 

World Cup™ since making their debut in 1994. 

 

10:00:57 The Super Eagles side who played at that tournament are widely considered 

as the country’s greatest group of players, with a team that included the likes 

of Finidi George, Daniel Amokachi, and the talismanic, Jay-Jay Okocha.  

 

10:01:10 24 years after their FIFA World Cup™ debut at USA 94, Okocha’s nephew, 

Alex Iwobi scored the goal in qualification that took Nigeria to their sixth 

global finals. 

 

10:01:29 Drawn in what many considered the toughest group in African qualifying, 

Nigeria proved dominant, securing their place in Russia with a game to spare 

and beating the likes of Zambia, Cameroon and Algeria along the way. 

 

 



2 
 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:01:42 When we saw the draw at first and we saw the group, we believed it would 

be very very difficult because Algeria at that moment was number 1 in 

Africa, Cameroon is becoming Champion of Africa and Zambia is becoming 

Champion of Africa under 20, so we were not terrified of this group but um 

we believed in our team, in our players.   

 

Wilfred Ndidi, Midfielder  

10:02:05 Everyone in the group was really tough. The Zambians, you feel, oh they're 

not the big names, like the other countries, but we took everything the 

same that was the philosophy from the coach. So, I think, that made us go 

through.   

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:02:22 We knew it was going to be tough. We have a very young team but 

everybody, they all play in Europe, they have the experience and they are 

all very good with the ball. We were so far ahead of everyone in the group 

and then we managed to finish the group as leaders, and we were very 

proud of that. 

 

10:02:41 On the pitch, the side is led by the seasoned John Obi Mikel, but their x-factor 

in Russia could be the youthful streak that runs throughout the side.  

 

10:02:50 With the likes of Abdullahi Shehu, William Troost-Ekong, and Wilfired Ndidi 

filling the defensive positions and Alex Iwobi, Kelechi Iheanacho and Moses 

Simon scoring crucial goals in qualifying, there is something of a fresh feel to 

the team 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:03:08 We choose young players, we wanted to build a new team, and I see now 

that we are the youngest one of the World Cup. Nigeria had already very 



3 
 

good teams, very big players, the level is very high to be better than them 

will not be easy for our young players but we are on the good way. 

 

10:03:32 Nigeria’s coach, Gernot Rohr, has plenty of experience on the continent 

having previously coached three African nations. He has radically improved 

the side, infusing the freshness of youth into a team who struggled prior to 

his appointment.  

 

10:03:45 Tactically, the team are based on a sturdy defence, with energetic ball-

winners at the base of midfield and the calming presence of John Obi Mikel in 

the number 10 position.  

 

10:03:58 Since Rohr took over in 2016, he has lost just once and knitted together a 

ruthless counterattacking side.  

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:04:02 The organisation was easy 4-2-3-1 or 4-3-3, everybody could play in this 

system and we only tried in the friendlies other systems, so tactically it was 

ok, we had a little problem at first to build a stable defence, but the 

defence is becoming solid 

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:04:27 This team is one team that I've played with that like to play football. You 

know, you have Victor Moses, you have Kelechi Ihenacho, you have Alex 

Iwobi, you have Ndidi, you have Onazi, you have Etebo... these players all 

like to have the ball, and it's important for us. We like to play, and pass and 

move, the discipline, there's a lot of calmness in the team and everybody 

knows his job. Everybody knows what to do. Everybody knows that you 

can't let the team down. 

 

10:04:56 A key-man in those counter attacks and the teams star-player is Victor 

Moses. Crowned 2018 Nigerian Football Federation player of the year, the 



4 
 

Chelsea star appeared in four of the Super Eagles 6 qualifying games and 

scored three goals   

 

10:05:11 Although he plays right-wingback for his club side, it’s in the forward position 

he causes damage for his national team. 

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:05:17 Antonio Conte wants him to play as a right wing back, but Victor has always 

played as a right winger. Victor is young, he’s fast, he’s strong, and he’s 

powerful. He has everything. 

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:05:35 Victor Moses, a fantastic player, he made the difference against Cameroon 

– when we beat the African champion 4-0 he was so fantastic and yes in the 

beginning, when I saw him the first time I immediately saw the talent, the 

qualities he had and we tried to bring it a quality system that he has also to 

play defensively and make the work when we don’t have the ball and he 

did it very well 

 

10:06:00 Drawn in group D, Nigeria kick-off their FIFA World Cup™ campaign on June 

16th against Croatia who reached the finals by beating Greece over two legs 

in the UEFA play offs.   

 

10:06:12 In what could be the most fiercely contested group in Russia, the Super 

Eagles will also play Iceland and Argentina.  

 

10:06:20 This will be the fifth time Nigeria will face La Albiceleste in their six 

tournament appearances with the South Americans having come out on top 

in each of their previous encounters. 

 

 

 



5 
 

Wilfred Ndidi, Midfielder  

10:06:29 Argentina team is very good. For me I would say Messi is unstoppable, I 

would say. Because he's one of the best players, we just have to try and win 

and give it all in the first two games and then face Argentina.  

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:06:45 I think we're in a group where we can do something, it depends on our 

preparation, it depends on how much we want it, how much we want to, 

not just "now we've qualified let's go and play in the World Cup, that's it 

fine, I played two or three games, that's it I'm done!". We want to make 

names, we want to make history, we want to do well. And we want to 

make sure we go there and believe we can beat Argentina, we can beat 

Croatia, we can beat Iceland.  

 

Gernot Rohr, Coach 

10:07:17 Of course, target is to play well, to give the best, to show to Nigeria that the 

players like to play for their country, they like to fight, and they like to win. 

We have a difficult group, will not be easy to come out, but we had already 

difficult group in the qualifiers. And we came out …I think will be a fantastic 

World Cup, it’s a joy for everybody to be here, but we would like also to 

have good results. 

 

10:07:54 We’re taking a look at the stadium where Nigeria will play their final group 

game now as we travel to the most northerly of the venues. 

 

10:08:05 St Petersburg is Russia’s second largest city after Moscow, the country’s 

cultural capital and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  

 



6 
 

10:08:11 The new 67,000 capacity St Petersburg stadium is located on the Neva River, 

although its northerly location provided some unique challenges for the 

designers.  

 

10:08:21 Built on the site of the Kirov Stadium on Krestovsky Island, the seven-storey 

structure is 79 metres high, with a retractable roof and sliding pitch. 

 

10:08:30 The venue is able to host events the whole year around as the temperature 

inside is regulated to 15 degrees Celsius, even in the depths of winter. 

 

10:08:39 The stadium played host to the opening match and the final of last year’s 

FIFA Confederations Cup, where Germany beat Chile 1-0. 

 

10:08:46 The St Petersburg stadium will also play an integral part in the FIFA World 

Cup™, hosting the likes of Russia, Brazil and Nigeria’s game with Argentina in 

a 7 match schedule that also includes a semi-final and the third place play off. 

 

10:08:59 But the action begins on June 15th as Morocco take on Iran in the opening 

game of Group B.  

 

10:09:07 In Hyundai Anatomy of a Goal, we go back to USA ‘94 to replay a stunning 

strike from a Super Eagle on his FIFA World Cup™ debut. 

 

10:09:18 In 1994 the FIFA World Cup™ landed in North America bigger than ever, 

Record crowds packed into stadiums to watch the likes of Romario, Jurgen 

Klinsmann and Gabriel Batistuta light up the USA. 



7 
 

10:09:33 Amongst the glitz and glamour, Nigeria arrived at the tournament to make 

their finals debut, boasting a FIFA World Ranking of 5th - the highest ever for 

an African nation. 

 

10:09:43 Clemens Westerhof’s side got off to the perfect start, beating Bulgaria 3-0 in 

their opening match.   

 

John Obi Mikel, Midfielder  

10:09:50 I had school the next morning and I think it was quite late in Nigeria, but 

everybody stayed up to watch the game. I remember my parents watching 

and trying to wake me up. I saw when Rashidi Yekini scored and he was 

doing that in the net in the goal.  

 

10:10:06 I think that was pretty much what I hold and what I remember of the World 

Cup.   

 

10:10:16 But defeat to Argentina left their hopes in the balance going into the final 

group game against Greece. 

 

10:10:24 Already ahead thanks to Finidi George’s opener, in the 95th minute, striker 

Daniel Amokachi was given space to turn in midfield, and made Greece pay 

with a demonstration of pace, power and perfect finishing. 

 

10:10:40 Replaying the goal we can see that, as Nigeria win back possession, Amokachi 

has already dropped deep into space and calls for the ball.  

 



8 
 

10:10:49 With the nearest Greek player more than 6 metres away, the Super Eagles 

number 14, has time to turn and head towards goal. 

 

10:11:00 With Greece’s centre half moving towards the right, it opens up the perfect 

angle for the Nigerian to advance and shoot. 

 

10:11:10 The ball accelerates to over 60 miles an hour past the helpless Christos 

Karkamanis in goal. 

 

10:11:17 In the next round, Amokachi and Nigeria came within seconds of knocking 

out eventual finalists Italy, before a Roberto Baggio brace rescued the Azzuri.  

 

10:11:28 While it may ultimately be a case of what might have been for the Super 

Eagles golden generation, in Amokachi’s goal they have a FIFA World Cup™ 

moment that will be remembered for years to come. 

 

10:11:41 We’re checking out two modern day strikers now and potential contenders 

for the Adidas golden boot – Robert Lewandowski of Poland and England’s 

Harry Kane. 

 

10:11:51 Using the CIES football observatory’s player rating system we’re going to 

compare their statistics in terms of shooting, distribution and taking on 

opponents. 

 

10:12:00 When it comes to prowess in front of goal both score an impressive 99 out of 

100 for shooting - a testament to their accuracy and composure.  

 



9 
 

10:12:08 While Kane found the back of the net 5 times for England in the FIFA World 

Cup™ qualifiers, 29-year-old Lewandowski scored a European high 16 goals 

which was over half of the 28 Poland scored in their campaign. 

 

Wojciech Szczęsny, Goalkeeper, Poland 

10:12:24 He has an enormous impact on the Polish team. Not only with his goals, as 

he scores lots of them, and most of our goals in these qualifiers were scored 

by Robert, but he was involved in creating them too.  

 

10:12:37 Equal when it comes to shooting, in terms of distribution the Polish striker 

edges his English counterpart with a 45 out of 100 compared to 35.  

 

10:12:46 Lewandowksi played all 10 of Poland’s qualifying matches, and despite most 

of his time being taken up by 37 attempts on goal, he still managed to set up 

Kamil Grosicki for the second strike in their 4-2 home victory against 

Montenegro.   

 

10:13:01 While the Polish star nudges it in terms of distribution, Kane has the better 

rating for taking on opponents  

 

10:13:07 It’s this trait that has helped him score a record-breaking 37 goals for Spurs in 

the English premier league and he has now scored 12 times in 23 

appearances for England. 

 

Gareth Southgate, Coach, England 

10:13:17 His goal scoring record at the moment speaks for itself, in terms of out an 

out number 9s, he is, no question, one of the best in the world. 

 



10 
 

10:13:25 He's proven that now, not just one season in the premier league, but 

season after season, and the last calendar year that he had was better than 

anyone else in Europe 

 

10:13:36 Despite the goal difference, that means the Englishman scores marginally 

higher overall on the CIES football index with 89 out of 100 compared to 

Lewandowski’s 88. 

 

10:13:47 With both Poland and England having had Adidas Golden Boot winners in the 

past, that award should not be out of reach for their current number nines. 

These two old-fashioned centre forwards can score almost any type of goal 

making them ones to watch in Russia. 

 

10:14:03 From 2 of Europe’s finest strikers, we stay with the European challenge, but 

travel 1,700 kilometres south-west of Moscow to take a closer look at the 

team who finished top of UEFA qualifying group D 

 

10:14:15 Ranked 37  Serbia return to the FIFA World Cup™ finals after an absence of 8 

years, and for only the second time after becoming an independent nation in 

2006.  

 

10:14:26 The team previously competed in the tournament as part of the Kingdom of 

Yugoslavia, SFR Yugoslavia, and Serbia and Montenegro.  

 

10:14:34 Their most notable appearance was in 1962 when they made it to the semi-

finals beating West Germany along the way.  

 



11 
 

10:14:42 Serbia qualified for the Russia 2018 in emphatic style. With only one defeat in 

10 matches, they scored the most goals in their group, outplaying the likes of 

Austria, the Republic of Ireland and Euro 2016 semi-finalists Wales. 

 

10:14:58 That string of results included an away victory against the Republic of Ireland 

- one of the stand out matches of their campaign.  

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:15:15 In the second half, we started the match and after about ten minutes the 

ball was on one side and I saw that it would probably come over to my side 

and I ran into the space. Kostić saw me. 

 

10:15:26 The ball was coming towards me and all I could do was stretch my leg and 

score. I knew that if I could get the shot in, the goalkeeper wouldn’t stand a 

chance. 

 

10:15:37 That goal turned out to be the winner that was a really important match for 

us and that win opened the door for us to the World Cup. 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:15:50 It was a difficult match. We knew what was expected of us and we knew 

that a goal either way would be decisive in the match.  

 

10:15:59 So thank God, we scored that goal and we won that game and I think that 

was the key match that took us to the World Cup. 

 



12 
 

10:16:09 Despite that result, their place at Russia 2018 wasn’t sealed until a one nil 

home victory against Georgia on the final day of qualifying.  

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:16:24 Well, I think that for me as a player that was the best night in my career. I 

think that all children in Serbia dream that one day they will play for the 

national team, to play important matches, 

 

10:16:35 To earn a place at the World Cup and to represent their nation there. For 

me that is the biggest, most exciting, and happiest story in my career as a 

footballer.   

 

10:16:49 Having qualified, Slavoljub Muslin was removed as coach, and replaced by the 

man who was his assistant, Mladen Krstajic.  

 

10:16:58 The former national team player could well turn out to be the side’s x-factor 

in Russia.  Having played for Serbia himself at the tournament, his experience 

on the FIFA World Cup™ stage could prove vital. 

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:17:10 One thing is for sure, it is an honour to be part of the national team, and 

especially being the selector for your own country is something that cannot 

be put into words, it can only be experienced. 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:17:24 He is big in Serbian football. Previously he was a great player who played 

for big teams and of course it means a lot to have somebody like that, who 

can give advice in those key matches. He went through that already and he 



13 
 

would advise us in the best possible way how to prepare for those difficult 

and important matches when everybody expects a lot from us. 

 

10:17:44 Krstajić is bringing his own style to the team’s formation, shoring up the 

defensive, and using his own playing experience to instigate change.  

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:17:55 As a coach and the man in charge of the Serbian team, I like the team to be 

compact in the defensive zone, but when they pass the halfway line, I want 

them to have their freedom in the game, and to do what they know best.  

 

10:18:08 The way I look at football in a way that we don’t have to be its slaves, we 

should enjoy football, because football is played with the heart and for 

fans, of course. 

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:18:19 During qualifying and for the first time since I’ve been in the team we 

played with three defenders. Let’s say we played a 3-4-3 formation with 

two wingers that come inside, a main striker and four in midfield. 

 

10:18:33 Myself and the right wing-back were really involved. 

 

10:18:36 I can say that was a specific style of playing. Not many national teams play 

that kind of game. When Krstajić came in as manager, the last two matches 

we played were friendlies and we played 4 at the back. So, I think that in 

the future we will continue playing that way and with 3 midfielders. These 

are all our coach’s plans. We play the way we are asked to. 

 



14 
 

10:19:01 Serbia’s star player is their captain Branislav Ivanovic. An experienced and 

respected member of the squad, he has led the team since 2012 and 

currently plays his club football in Russia for Zenit Saint Petersburg. 

 

Mladen Krstajić, Coach 

10:19:16 He is really important, for sure. One number in a hundred games as part of 

the national team means a lot, and that says a lot about Bane Ivanović, as a 

person and as a player as well. His games are seen and recognized, and 

recorded worldwide I can talk about him only in superlatives.  

 

10:19:33 He was the coach’s right-hand man before, and has remained as such, even 

today, when I have the coach’s position 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:19:45 Branislav - I don’t know how he looks on the field, maybe scary, but he is, 

first of all, a very good person. I think that even he, himself, is not aware 

how successful he is in his career, how much he has achieved and when he 

finishes his career he is going to realize how great he is.  

 

10:20:06 Serbia kick off their campaign on the 17th of June against Costa Rica who 

were surprise quarter finalists at the 2014 FIFA World Cup™. 

 

10:20:15 But in a group that also includes Brazil, they’ll have to be at the top of their 

game to reach the knockout stages in Russia.  

 

Aleksandar Kolarov, Defender 

10:20:25 We have to try to take our chances in the matches against Costa Rica and 

Switzerland. I think we got a good deal. We play the third match against 



15 
 

Brazil so let’s hope that we won’t get to that match to decide whether we 

get through or not.  If it comes to that, we will fight to go further. 

 

 

Aleksandar Mitrović, Forward 

10:20:46 I think we have a team, especially now, a team with players who can play 

against Brazil and every single national team in the world.  

 

10:20:55 We have a great team and as I said, we will see… I hope that we are going 

to pass forward from the group, that’s the first goal. We will see, with God’s 

help. 

 

10:21:15 Serbia’s group opponents Brazil are the focus of our FIFA World Cup™ firsts 

now as we look back at the 1950 and 2014 tournaments. 

 

10:21:24 Unlike previous editions, the 1950 FIFA World Cup™ would be the first and 

only one not to have a final. 

 

10:21:32 Instead, in the deciding match of the tournament, hosts Brazil needed just a 

draw against Uruguay to see them crowned champions.  

 

10:21:41 In front of a crowd of almost 200 000 at the Maracana, Friaca gave the home 

side the lead. 

 

10:21:51 Uruguay weren’t to be overawed though, as Juan Schiaffino equalised just 

past the hour mark. 

 



16 
 

10:21:59 And 11 minutes from time, one of the biggest upsets at a finals was 

completed as Alcides Ghiggia scored to send a newly named Jules Rimet 

trophy back to Uruguay for the 2nd time. 

 

10:22:13 When Brazil next hosted the FIFA World Cup™ in 2014, the tournament 

marked the debut for goal line technology, along with vanishing spray used 

by referees.   

 

10:22:25 Greece and Algeria were making their debuts in the FIFA World Cup™ finals, 

with the North African side making it through to the round of 16 where they 

lost to Germany after extra time.   

 

10:22:38 Hosts Brazil had topped their group, and following victories over Chile and 

Colombia, made it through to their fourth consecutive FIFA World Cup™ 

semi-final.  

 

10:22:47 Their opponents at the Maracana were Germany, and over the course of 90 

minutes, a whole host of records were broken.  

 

10:22:55 Miroslav Klose overtook Ronaldo as the tournament’s all-time leading scorer 

as he netted his 16th FIFA World Cup™ goal in the 23rd minute.    

 

10:23:09 Germany’s 7-1 victory saw them replace Brazil as the highest scoring team in 

the tournament’s history and become the first team to reach 8 FIFA World 

Cup finals™;  

 



17 
 

10:23:22 But there were still two more firsts to come as Germany met Argentina in the 

final. 

10:23:29 The only goal of the game came in extra time, as Mario Gotze became the 

first substitute to score the winning goal in a FIFA World Cup final™. 

 

10:23:40 And it was a result that gave Germany the honour of becoming the first 

European side to win the trophy in the Americas.  

 

10:23:52 Finally, we’re with Argentina goalkeeper Sergio Romero, as the Brazil 2014 

finalist gives us his favourite FIFA World Cup™ memory. 

 

10:24:01 For Argentina, the 2014 tournament proved their most successful in almost 

25 years. After winning their group and despatching Switzerland and Belgium 

in the knockout stages they came up against the Netherlands in the semi-

finals. 

 

Sergio Romero, Goalkeeper (ARG) 

10:24:15 It was a truly tactical game. If we had the ball, then Holland defended. And 

if Holland had the ball, then we defended. We were well positioned, it was 

completely tactical, with very few chances to score for both sides.  

 

10:24:27 After 120 minutes had failed to separate them, the game went to penalties. 

With the spotlight now on the two keepers, Romero received some words of 

advice from team mate Javier Mascherano. 

 

 



18 
 

Sergio Romero, Goalkeeper (ARG) 

10:24:39 I’d already talked to the coach Alejandro, and the other goalkeepers 

Mariano and Agustin and when I was heading over to talk to the referees, 

Mascherano grabbed hold of me, and well he told me to think about all of 

the people who had helped me get to that moment.  That everything was 

going was going to be okay, and he ended by saying that I was going to be a 

hero. So I was already confident, but these words made me even more 

confident. It’s at times like that you really see the people who have your 

back, and you never forget that moment. 

 

10:25:15 It took only a matter of seconds for Mascherano’s prediction to come true, as 

Romero dived first to his left and then to his right saving two penalties in the 

shootout. 

 

10:24:24 His heroics sent Argentina through to the final.  Germany were to deny them 

a third FIFA World Cup™, but for the goalkeeper the moment when he 

became a hero in the semi-finals is one he will never forget. 

 

10:24:39 That’s it for now, but join us next time as we continue on the Road to the 

2018 FIFA World Cup™ in Russia.

Trois dentistes, trois diagnostics différents. C’est l’histoire de Camille, une téléspectatrice troublée qui a décidé de contacter ABE pour y voir plus clair

Comment la viande hachée est-elle préparée? Avec quels morceaux de viande ? Pourquoi son prix peut-il varier du simple au double ? Est-elle de bonne qualité ? ABE répondra à ces questions avec des éleveurs, des bouchers. Avec une batterie de tests aussi, menés sur des steaks hachés et des lasagnes bolognaises.

Prise en charge incomplète, pression sur la patiente, et pourquoi trois consultations, trois diagnostiques ?  Explications avec Martine Riesen, Présidente Association des Médecins-Dentistes de Genève.
ABE a fait analyser par un laboratoire 16 steaks hachés frais achetés dans des boucheries et en grandes surfaces.
ABE a fait comparer la proportion réelle de viande dans des lasagnes bolognaise à celle annoncée sur l'emballage

Le licenciement d’une assistante dentaire, un devis de 1694.- présenté à cette téléspectatrice, comprenant un traitement de racine dit urgent, qui en fait ne l’était pas, sans lui expliquer s’il y avait une alternative possible. Les explications du Dr Rabah Nedir.

Hamburger, lasagne ou steak, la consommation de viande hachée ne cesse d’augmenter ces dernières années.  Une aubaine pour la filière bovine ? Pour mieux y comprendre, ABE s’est rendu chez Suter Viandes et chez Benoît Marti, boucher de campagne, éleveur et propriétaire d’un abattoir à Estavayer-le-Lac.

Peu onéreuses et très pratiques, les lasagnes industrielles sont abondantes dans nos supermarchés. Mais de quelle viande s’agit-il ? Peuvent-elles rivaliser avec celles concoctées dans les cuisines italiennes ? Les emballages répondent-ils à leur promesse ? Nous avons sélectionné et préparé 10 lasagnes différentes, Armando Miele, propriétaire d’une épicerie italienne ainsi que trois gastronomes en culottes courtes nous donnent leur avis.

La Suisse négocie un accord de libre-échange avec le Mercosur, ce marché qui regroupe l’Uruguay, le Paraguay, le Brésil et l’Argentine. Le « deal » : ouvrir leur marché aux assurances, aux montres et aux machines-outils suisses à une condition : pouvoir exporter leur viande à des prix préférentiels. La colère gronde chez les éleveurs de bovins.
Comment les fabricants ou distributeurs de lasagnes expliquent-ils la différence de quantité de viande entre celle annoncée sur l’emballage et celle mesurée par le labo ?
Bernard Lonati, chef de cuisine de Ma Colombière à Lully (GE) cuisine son fameux hachis parmentier sous l'œil des caméras d'ABE.

10:00:18:04  10:00:19:09

10:00:19:13  10:00:23:21
    Ce soir, il sera question
d'un rendez-vous chez le dentiste:

10:00:24:02  10:00:26:17
     méthodologie, diagnostic,
           licenciement;

10:00:26:22  10:00:28:20
    cette histoire interpelle.

10:00:29:01  10:00:32:09
     Au menu d'ABE également,
        la viande hachée:

10:00:32:13  10:00:36:06
     derrière une barquette, 
     il y a toute une filière

10:00:36:11  10:00:39:07
     et un contexte économique
           passionnant.

10:00:39:11  10:00:40:19
         Enquête et tests.

10:00:49:04  10:00:50:11
          Aussi étonnant

10:00:50:16  10:00:52:11
      que ça puisse paraître,

10:00:52:16  10:00:55:04
         la viande hachée
       évite le gaspillage !

10:00:55:09  10:00:59:19
      Je vois déjà les sourcils
des végétariens et végans se froncer,

10:01:00:00  10:01:02:14
       mais la viande hachée
         permet d'utiliser

10:01:02:19  10:01:05:05
 les morceaux les moins appréciés,

10:01:05:10  10:01:07:00
      ce qui ne veut pas dire

10:01:07:05  10:01:09:19
        qu'elle doit être 
       de mauvaise qualité.

10:01:10:00  10:01:11:09
         On le vérifiera.

10:01:11:13  10:01:14:00
  On entre dans le vif du sujet.

10:01:23:09  10:01:26:12
         -Nous travaillons
    avec de la viande de boeuf,

10:01:26:17  10:01:28:01
           qu'on appelle

10:01:28:06  10:01:29:14
     de la viande pour hacher.

10:01:29:19  10:01:33:13
 Ce sont des morceaux sélectionnés
      dans l'épaule de boeuf

10:01:33:18  10:01:37:01
    qui ont un taux de graisse
         d'environ 15 %.

10:01:37:06  10:01:41:00
     C'est de la marchandise
qui arrive fraîche tous les jours.

10:01:41:05  10:01:44:21
   L'épaule est un morceau idéal
     parce qu'il est graisseux

10:01:45:02  10:01:48:12
  et j'ai besoin de cette graisse
        pour avoir du goût

10:01:48:17  10:01:52:19
    et pour avoir du jus quand
 vous faites ça dans la casserole,

10:01:53:00  10:01:55:13
      parce que sans graisse,
          ce serait sec.

10:01:55:18  10:01:57:18
  -Nous aurions souhaité filmer

10:01:57:23  10:02:01:00
         la fabrication
  de steaks hachés industriels.

10:02:01:05  10:02:04:03
 Mais aucun grand transformateur
            de viande

10:02:04:08  10:02:06:11
          n'a accepté
      d'ouvrir ses portes.

10:02:06:15  10:02:09:03
    Seule la boucherie Suter
          à Villeneuve

10:02:09:08  10:02:11:05
   nous a réservé bon accueil.

10:02:11:10  10:02:13:22
        Cette entreprise
      n'abat pas d'animaux

10:02:14:03  10:02:16:12
mais transforme des produits carnés

10:02:16:17  10:02:19:23
 pour des boucheries régionales
       et la gastronomie.

10:02:20:04  10:02:22:09
   -La viande hachée représente

10:02:22:13  10:02:24:10
    une partie de plus en plus

10:02:24:14  10:02:26:15
     importante de nos ventes.

10:02:26:20  10:02:29:23
         C'est un produit
qui est en constante augmentation.

10:02:30:04  10:02:34:15
 La viande hachée est une aubaine 
 car on peut utiliser des morceaux

10:02:34:20  10:02:39:10
      qui étaient peu utilisés
et on peut valoriser la bête entière.

10:02:43:12  10:02:46:02
-Une aubaine, la viande hachée ?

10:02:46:07  10:02:49:10
     Pour la filière bovine,
       c'est une évidence.

10:02:49:14  10:02:53:10
      Elle permet d'écouler
les morceaux les moins appréciés.

10:02:53:14  10:02:58:06
 Pour comprendre cela nous sommes
allés voir un boucher de campagne,

10:02:58:11  10:03:00:20
Benoît Marti, qui est aussi éleveur

10:03:01:01  10:03:04:04
  et propriétaire d'un abattoir
       à Estavayer-le-Lac.

10:03:04:09  10:03:07:21
  Nous commençons notre visite 
 par un cours d'anatomie bovine.

10:03:08:02  10:03:12:05
    -La viande hachée est prise
 sur le quartier avant de la bête,

10:03:12:10  10:03:14:11
    on la sort sur les flancs,

10:03:14:16  10:03:17:08
 à voir s'ils sont pas trop gras,

10:03:17:12  10:03:20:01
      sinon la viande hachée
         est trop grasse.

10:03:20:06  10:03:23:17
     Il y a le grumeau aussi,
       l'épaule, la nuque.

10:03:23:22  10:03:28:01
-Toutes ces parties sont souvent
   appelées les bas morceaux

10:03:28:06  10:03:33:07
par opposition aux morceaux nobles,
plus tendres mais aussi plus chers.

10:03:37:20  10:03:45:11
 -Là, on a la parisienne, la côte 
de boeuf, l'entrecôte, le rumsteck.

10:03:45:15  10:03:49:09
      Mais l'aloyau vraiment,
  c'est le rumsteck, l'entrecôte,

10:03:49:13  10:03:54:03
   et la côte et de l'autre côté,
il y a encore le filet à l'intérieur.

10:03:54:08  10:03:56:11
 L'aloyau ne représente que 10 %,

10:03:56:16  10:04:00:11
      c'est très peu il faut
    mettre en valeur le reste.

10:04:00:15  10:04:05:00
C'est une carcasse qui a été abattue
        lundi, on est jeudi,

10:04:05:05  10:04:09:06
   on laisse rassir une semaine,
 ce qui permet de perdre du poids,

10:04:09:11  10:04:12:04

        on perd de l'eau.

10:04:12:09  10:04:14:05
   Dans la grande distribution,

10:04:14:10  10:04:18:02

   12h à 24h après l'abattage.

10:04:21:13  10:04:25:14
  -De l'abattoir, Benoît Marti 
  amène ses quartiers de viande

10:04:25:19  10:04:29:11
        dans sa boucherie
 pour les découper et les parer.

10:04:33:00  10:04:36:04
        -La viande hachée,
    c'est 24h de conservation,

10:04:36:09  10:04:37:15
        donc si elle reste

10:04:37:20  10:04:40:06
déjà 8-12 heures dans une vitrine.

10:04:40:11  10:04:45:01

10:04:45:06  10:04:47:06
   Je préfère la faire fraîche.

10:04:47:11  10:04:51:11
   Le client vient chez nous et
 il me demande de la viande hachée

10:04:51:16  10:04:53:12

10:04:53:17  10:04:57:02
Certains veulent de la viande hachée

10:04:57:07  10:04:59:07

10:04:59:11  10:05:02:12

   à moins de 10 % de graisse,

10:05:02:17  10:05:04:06
       c'est plutôt rare.

  un signe de mauvaise qualité,

10:05:11:10  10:05:15:18

sera aussi plus goûtue et juteuse.

10:05:15:23  10:05:19:07

10:05:19:11  10:05:25:00

10:05:39:21  10:05:41:13

10:08:00:03  10:08:02:11

10:08:10:04  10:08:13:20

           du Molard (GE)

 avec un faible taux de graisse
